item.title: Iran appoints new central bank governor after record currency fall and mass protests
item.description: Iran has appointed a new central bank governor after the former one resigned following a record currency drop against the U.S. dollar

item.title: Channel Tunnel power malfunction fixed, but rail delays may linger
item.description: Trains through the Channel Tunnel between Europe and the UK are running again after a power malfunction caused chaos

item.title: China factory activity picks up in December as orders rebound ahead of holidays

item.title: Bulgaria to become the 21st country to join the euro, deepening EU ties despite fears
item.description: Bulgaria is joining the euro on New Year's Day
